statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Howard 80, North Carolina A&T 75
article.story: WASHINGTON (AP) -- Darek Mitchell scored a career-high 32 points, including a disputed 3-pointer in the final two minutes, to help Howard beat North Carolina A&T 80-75 in a game marred by two ejections. Howard (8-15, 4-7 Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference) sealed the win at the free throw line after Aggies coach Jerry Eaves, a former Howard assistant, was issued a double technical foul and ejected with his team trailing 78-75 with 1.8 seconds remaining. After N.C. A&T's Glenn Nelson had his attempt at a game-tying 3-pointer blocked out of bounds, Eaves began shouting at the officials for allowing Mitchell's 3-pointer with 1:29 to play. Mitchell's basket, his eighth 3-pointer of the game, came after the Aggies (10-13, 6-5) used a 15-5 run to pull within one. However, he appeared to release the ball after the shot clock expired. Eaves was irate, but he temporarily calmed when Steven Rush made a 3-pointer to make the score 76-75. Howard's Will Gant then drained an eight-foot runner with 13.4 seconds to play, setting the stage for the wild finish. Mitchell made sure Howard didn't miss leading scorer Darryl Hudson, who was booted for committing a hard foul against the Aggies' Jason Wills with five minutes left in the first half. Hudson, who averages 16 points per game, did not score.
